Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers took a disappointing 115-103 loss to the rebuilding Detroit Pistons on Monday night.
Others: Anthony Davis continued on MVP-caliber tear with 37 points on 13-23 shooting from the field along with nine rebounds and four assists.
D'Angelo Russell struggled with 11 points on an inefficient 4-14 shooting from the field.
The Lakers' bench combined for a grand total of 10 points on the affair.
Rui Hachimura was a letdown with eight points on 2-6 shooting from the floor against the Pistons.
